item.title: Writing a Kubernetes Controller
item.description: Even when knowing Go, writing a Kubernetes controller is intimidating. In this post, I’ll introduce the Kubernetes operating model, how objects are mapped and what are the tools provided by the go-client framework to write bullet proof controllers. I will describe the core components like: ClientSets Informers Work Queues (and RateLimiting Work Queues) and how they fit together in writing a Kubernetes controller. The content of this post is inspired by the “It’s all about reconciliation, anatomy of a kubernetes controller” talk I gave this summer as part of the GoWay conference.
